subject: Re: How to get fixture from TestSetup
msgSnippet: oops... I was working on the assumption of external entities -- which the only reason I have used TestSetup.  My fault.  I will make sure to have a full cup of
messageBody:
oops... I was working on the assumption of external entities -- which the only reason I have used TestSetup. My fault. I will make sure to have a full cup of coffee next time before answering.

And no - I did not mean flame in that sense... What is the correct saying?

-jason

--- In junit@y..., "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:
> Not to steal J.B.'s flame, but I think this is what
> you may be looking for:<BR>
>
> <snip content="example" />
>
> I assume you didn't mean "flame" in the sense it's
> usually used on newsgroups. :)
>
> As for your example, I'm not sure how it gives the
> test case objects access to data created by setUp()
> and tearDown(). If the one-time setup does something
> in an external data source, like a database, then all
> is well; but if it changes data inside the JVM, how do
> the test cases gain access to that data? Class-level
> variables, I guess.
>
> :)
>
> JBR.
>
>
